lesson.title: Gradle for Java
lesson.summary: Understand the Gradle Java plugin, build and test Java projects, and manage dependencies.

atoms.title: Gradle Plugins
atoms.instructor_notes: If you want to jump straight into the Gradle documentation on plugins, check it out here.

atoms.title: Plugin Capabilities
atoms.instructor_notes: Check out the Gradle documentation on plugins here.

atoms.title: Applying the Java Plugin
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.01-Demo-ApplyingTheJavaPlugin folder. As you can see, building Java projects with Gradle is extremely simple. You may want to take a look at some more examples on building Java projects.

atoms.title: Create a JAR
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.02-Exercise-UseTheJavaPlugin folder.

atoms.title: Conventions and Configuration
atoms.instructor_notes: Check out this page for more information on how Gradle uses conventions to facilitate concise build scripts while still allowing you to customize your project. You can read more about the Java base plugin here. Source sets are groups of related source files that are compiled and executed together. You can learn more in the Gradle user guide here and in the Gradle DSL reference here

atoms.title: Java Plugin Documentation
atoms.instructor_notes: Here's the Java quick start guide. Here's the full chapter on the Java plugin.

atoms.title: Java Task Dependencies
atoms.instructor_notes: Here's the chapter of the Gradle user guide on the Java plugin.

atoms.title: Configure the Java Plugin
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.03-Exercise-ConfigureTheJavaPlugin folder.

atoms.title: Dependency Management
atoms.instructor_notes: Head here to find out more about Gradle's advanced dependency management features.

atoms.title: Working with Repositories
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.04-Demo-WorkingWithRepositories folder. An overview of Gradle's dependency management features can be found in the [Dependency Management Basics](http://gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/artifact_dependencies_tutorial.html) chapter of the Gradle User Guide. For a more in-depth knowledge of handling dependencies and repositories in Gradle, check out the [full chapter](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/dependency_management.html) on the subject.

atoms.title: Declaring Dependencies
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.05-Demo-DeclaringDependencies folder. More details on how to declare dependencies in a Gradle build script can be found in the Gradle DSL Reference

atoms.title: Declare Dependencies
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.06-Exercise-DeclareARepositoryAndDependencies folder.

atoms.title: Dependency Reports
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.07-Demo-DependencyReports folder.

atoms.title: Configurations
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.08-Demo-Configurations folder.

atoms.title: Create a Custom Configuration
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.09-Exercise-AddDependenciesToCustomConfiguration folder. Whoops, I meant `basename-appendix-version-classifier.extension`.

atoms.title: Java Unit Testing
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.10-Demo-JavaUnitTests folder. For more information on automating unit testing with Gradle, check out this section of the Gradle user guide.

atoms.title: Run Unit Tests
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.11-Exercise-WorkWithUnitTests folder.

atoms.title: Finding Gradle Plugins
atoms.instructor_notes: Head here for the Gradle user guide chapter regarding core Gradle plugins. Be sure to also visit the Gradle Plugin Portal to browse through the hundreds of community contributed plugins, or to learn how to contribute your own!

atoms.title: Advanced Gradle Wrapper
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this demo is in the 2.12-Demo-AdvancedGradleWrapper folder. You can find more information in the Gradle Wrapper chapter of the Gradle user guide.

atoms.title: Configure The Gradle Wrapper
atoms.instructor_notes: The code for this exercise is in the 2.13-Exercise-ConfigureTheGradleWrapper folder.
